{{infobox record label
 | name = Transmission Communications image = image_bg = white parent = founded

'Transmission Communications' (or Trans:Com) is an independent record label
based in Brisbane, Australia. The label focusses on production and performance
of electronic music; including techno, industrial, synthpop, experimental, and
all manner of crossovers.

During the 1990s, the label released a range of compilations for the Brisbane
scene, including Evidence, Cyberia, and Abstraction, as well as releasing
works from Pure Bunk, Low Key Operations, Sphere, Tycho Brahe, The Blood
Party, All Electric Kitchen, and others. Additionally the label has curated
showcases, including Cyberia (1995), 101 (2001), the Silhouette Series (2006),
and Upgrade (2007).

The label is now focussed on digital distribution and aggregation through iTunes
and others, and is still involved in progressing Brisbane as one of Australia's
key centres for alternative music production.
